data.text:
Tripoli, Libya

Latitude and longitude coordinates are: 32.885353, 13.180161.

Tripoli (طرابلس), also known as Tripoli-of-the-West, is the most populous city and the capital of Libya. The city is close to the Tunisian border, situated on the continent of Africa. It is also an important port, transshipment, and industrial center of the whole region. It is located in the northwest of the country, lies along the Mediterranean coast, and is a key tourist attraction for those who are wondering about the history and culture of this historic nation. You can find a lot of Libyan and international companies' offices in the central business district of the city. It is also home to Tripoli International Fair (TIF) which is an important annual commercial exhibition and is known as the oldest trade fair in the continent. In addition, The University of Tripoli (UOT) was founded in 1957 and it is the largest university in Libya. There are many other international schools in the city.

The city has interesting landmarks and points of interest, such as The Red Castle Museum, Marcus Aurelius Triumphal Arch, Ottoman Clock Tower, The House of Karamanly, Tripoli's Old City, Apostolic Vicariate of Tripoli, June 11 Stadium, Istiqlal Street, Royal Palace of Tripoli, Tripoli Beach, Algeria Square Mosque (Tripoli Cathedral), Tripoli's Medina, Street Murals, Tripoli's Jamahiriya Museum, Maidan al Jazair Square Mosque, Martyrs' Square, Gurgi Mosque, and Al-Majidya Mosque. Mitiga International Airport is located 5 miles east of the city center.
